intro: Hyalolaena collina, commonly known as the coastal hyalolaena, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble single blooms. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the shoreline, where it is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and often pale in color. Hyalolaena collina plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and provides habitat for various insects and small animals.
